children.name: open
Example - subscribe to the "open" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "open" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the calendar or the time drop-down list is opened

children.name: close
Example - subscribe to the "close" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "close" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the calendar or the time drop-down list is closed

children.name: change
Example - subscribe to the "change" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "change" event during initialization

children.description: Triggered when the underlying value of a DateTimePicker is changed.

children.name: value
Example - sets the value of the widget
Example - gets the value of the widget

parameters.name: value `Date|String`
parameters.description: The time value to set for a DateTimePicker, expressed as a Date object or as a string.

children.description: Gets or sets the value of the DateTimePicker.

children.name: toggle

parameters.name: view `String`
parameters.description: The view of the DateTimePicker, expressed as a string.Available views are "time" and "date".

children.description: Toggles the calendar or the time drop-down list.

children.name: open

parameters.name: view `String`
parameters.description: The view of the DateTimePicker, expressed as a string.Available views are "time" and "date".

children.description: Opens the calendar or the time drop-down list.

children.name: min
Example - set the min value of the DateTimePicker
Example - get the min value of the DateTimePicker

parameters.name: value `Date|String`
parameters.description: The minimum time value to set for a DateTimePicker, expressed as a Date object or as a string.

children.description: Gets or sets the minimum value of the DateTimePicker.

children.name: max
Example - set the max value of the DateTimePicker
Example - get the max value of the DateTimePicker

parameters.name: value `Date|String`
parameters.description: The maximum time value to set for a DateTimePicker, expressed as a Date object or as a string.

children.description: Gets or sets the maximum value of the DateTimePicker.

children.name: readonly

parameters.name: readonly `Boolean`
parameters.description: The argument, which defines whether the DateTimePicker should be readonly or editable.

children.description: Toggles the readonly state of the widget. When the widget is readonly it doesn't allow user input.> There is a difference between disabled and readonly mode. The value of a disabled widget is **not** posted as part of a `form` whereas the value of a readonly widget is posted.

children.name: enable

parameters.name: enable `Boolean`
parameters.description: Enables (**true** or undefined) or disables (**false**) a DateTimePicker.

children.description: Enables or disables a DateTimePicker.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **DateTimePicker** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the DateTimePicker element from DOM.

children.name: close

parameters.name: view `String`
parameters.description: The view of the DateTimePicker, expressed as a string.Available views are "time" and "date".

children.description: Closes the calendar or the time drop-down list.

children.name: Example - get options of the widget
value
children.description: Specifies the selected value.

children.name: timeFormat
children.description: Specifies the format, which is used to format the values in the time drop-down list.

children.name: start
Example - specify the initial view, which calendar renders

children.description: Specifies the start view of the calendar. The following settings are available for the **start** value:

children.name: parseFormats
children.description: Specifies the formats, which are used to parse the value set with value() method or by direct input. If not set the value of the `options.format` and `options.timeFormat` will be used. Note that value of the `format` option is always used. The `timeFormat` value also will be used if defined. > Order of the provided parse formats is important and it should from stricter to less strict.

children.name: month.empty
Example - add date value to the out-of-range cells
Example - specify an empty cell template as a string

children.description: The template used for rendering cells in the calendar "month" view, which are outside the min/max range.

children.name: month.content
Example - specify cell template as a string

children.description: Template to be used for rendering the cells in the calendar "month" view, which are in range.

children.name: month
children.description: Templates for the cells rendered in the calendar "month" view.

children.name: min
children.description: Specifies the minimum date that the calendar can show.

children.name: max
children.description: Specifies the maximum date, which the calendar can show.

children.name: interval
children.description: Specifies the interval, between values in the popup list, in minutes.

children.name: format
Example - specify a custom date format

children.description: Specifies the format, which is used to format the value of the DateTimePicker displayed in the input. The format also will be used to parse the input.

children.name: footer
Example - specify footer template as a string
Example - specify footer template as a function

children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) which renders the footer of the calendar. If false, the footer will not be rendered.

children.name: disableDates
Example - use a function to disabled dates
Example - specify an array of dates to be disabled
Example - specify an array of days to be disabled

children.description: An array or function that will be used to determine which dates to be disabled for selection by the widget.

children.name: depth
Example - set navigation depth of the calendar popup

children.description: Specifies the navigation depth of the calendar. The followingsettings are available for the **depth** value:- *"month"* shows the days of the month- *"year"* shows the months of the year- *"decade"* shows the years of the decade- *"century"* shows the decades from the century> Note the option will not be applied if **start** option is *lower* than **depth**. Always set both and **start** and **depth** options.

children.name: dates
Example - specify a list of dates

children.description: Specifies a list of dates, which will be passed to the [month template](#configuration-month.content) of the DateView.All dates, which match the date portion of the selected date will be used to re-bind the TimeView.

children.name: culture
children.description: Specifies the culture info used by the widget.

children.name: ARIATemplate
children.description: Specifies a template used to populate value of the aria-label attribute.

children.name: animation.open.duration
children.description: The duration of the open animation in milliseconds.

children.name: animation.open.effects
children.description: The effect(s) to use when playing the open animation. Multiple effects should be separated with a space.[Complete list of available animations](/api/javascript/effects/common)

children.name: animation.open
children.description: The animation played when the popup is opened.

children.name: animation.close.duration
children.description: The duration of the close animation in milliseconds.

children.name: animation.close.effects
children.description: The effect(s) to use when playing the close animation. Multiple effects should be separated with a space.[Complete list of available animations](/api/javascript/effects/common)

children.name: animation.close
children.description: The animation played when a popup is closed.

children.name: animation
Example - disable open and close animations

children.description: Configures the opening and closing animations of the popups. Setting the `animation` option to `false` will disable the opening and closing animations. As a result the popup will open and close instantly.
